1.text: Give your horse a healthy treat

2.text: Hold another treat 2 feet (0.61 m) away from your horse.

3.text: Put the treat next to an object and say “touch.

4.text: Hold a treat to your cheek and say "kiss.

5.text: Feed your horse the treat when it touches its snout to your face.

6.text: Give verbal praise to your horse after feeding it the treat.

7.text: Push your horse's snout away if it tries to eat the treat before touching your face.

8.text: Repeat the process to reinforce the behavior.

9.text: Try saying "kiss" without offering a treat once your horse gets the hang of it.

11.text: Repeat the training 2-3 times a week.

12.text: Teach your horse not to bite

13.text: Move your horse's head away from you whenever it nips.

14.text: Provide free-choice grass hay for young horses that are teething.

15.text: Correct biting behavior immediately but not severely.
